text: Abaeté Aviação is a regional airline and air taxi based in Salvador, Bahia, Brazil. The company started in 1979 as Aerotáxi Abaeté. Although it began operations in 1979, it did not offer regular flights until 2020. ==History== ===Aerotáxi Abaeté (1979-2020)=== Abaeté was founded on February 19, 1979, by Milton Tosto and Jorge Mello. The company initially offered air services with a Piper PA-28 Cherokee to cities in Bahia. In 1985, it expanded by acquiring Atlanta Táxi Aéreo. In 1995, Aerotáxi Abaeté took over Nordeste Linhas Aéreas and created Abaeté Linhas Aéreas, which flew to several cities in Bahia. However, in 2012, due to financial losses, Abaeté Linhas Aéreas stopped its commercial flights. ===Abaeté Aviação (2020-present)=== In 2020, Aerotáxi Abaeté transformed into Abaeté Aviação, allowed to operate regular flights with small aircraft under new aviation regulations. The company launched regular commercial flights in December 2020, initially to Morro de São Paulo. The airline continued to expand its routes in Bahia and in 2021, it became a member of the International Air Transport Association (IATA). It also partnered with GOL Linhas Aéreas for codeshare flights, connecting Bahia’s interior with other regions in Brazil. ==Fleet== Abaeté Aviação Fleet Aircraft In Service Orders Passengers Note Beechcraft King Air C90 1 -- 6 Only for VIP flights Cessna 208 Caravan 5 -- 9 Scheduled and non-scheduled flights Hawker Beechcraft 400 2 -- 8 Only for VIP flights Embraer EMB 110 Bandeirante 1 -- 14 Only for non-scheduled flights Embraer EMB 821 Carajá 3 -- 8 Only for VIP flights TOTAL 12 -- ==References== Category:1979 establishments
title: Abaeté Linhas Aéreas
